**Greatest Royal Rumble**[3] was a [professional
wrestling](/wiki/Professional_wrestling "Professional wrestling") [pay-per-
view](/wiki/Pay-per-view "Pay-per-view") [event](/wiki/List_of_WWE_pay-per-
view_events "List of WWE pay-per-view events")[4] and [WWE
Network](/wiki/WWE_Network "WWE Network")
[event](/wiki/List_of_WWE_Network_events "List of WWE Network events")[5][6]
promoted by [WWE](/wiki/WWE "WWE") for their [Raw](/wiki/Raw_\(WWE_brand\)
"Raw \(WWE brand\)") and [SmackDown](/wiki/SmackDown_\(WWE_brand\) "SmackDown
\(WWE brand\)") [brands](/wiki/WWE_brand_extension "WWE brand extension"). The
event was held on April 27, 2018 at the [King Abdullah Sports
City](/wiki/King_Abdullah_Sports_City "King Abdullah Sports City")'s King
Abdullah International Stadium in [Jeddah](/wiki/Jeddah "Jeddah"), [Saudi
Arabia](/wiki/Saudi_Arabia "Saudi Arabia").[3][7] The event was scheduled for
7:00 p.m. local time. It aired live in the [United States](/wiki/United_States
"United States") at noon [EDT](/wiki/Eastern_Time_Zone "Eastern Time Zone"),
with a pre-show starting at 11 a.m. EDT.[8] At the event, all men's main
roster championships were defended, in addition to a 50-man [Royal Rumble
match](/wiki/Royal_Rumble_match "Royal Rumble match").[9]

The card featured ten matches. In the main event, [Braun
Strowman](/wiki/Braun_Strowman "Braun Strowman") won the titular Greatest
Royal Rumble match to become the inaugural Greatest Royal Rumble Champion. In
the penultimate match, [Brock Lesnar](/wiki/Brock_Lesnar "Brock Lesnar")
retained the [Universal Championship](/wiki/WWE_Universal_Championship "WWE
Universal Championship") in a [steel cage
match](/wiki/Professional_wrestling_match_types#Steel_Cage_match "Professional
wrestling match types") against [Roman Reigns](/wiki/Roman_Reigns "Roman
Reigns"). On the undercard, the [WWE Championship](/wiki/WWE_Championship "WWE
Championship") match between [AJ Styles](/wiki/A.J._Styles "A.J. Styles") and
[Shinsuke Nakamura](/wiki/Shinsuke_Nakamura "Shinsuke Nakamura") resulted in a
double countout, [The Undertaker](/wiki/The_Undertaker "The Undertaker")
defeated [Rusev](/wiki/Rusev_\(wrestler\) "Rusev \(wrestler\)") in a casket
match, and [John Cena](/wiki/John_Cena "John Cena") defeated [Triple
H](/wiki/Triple_H "Triple H") in the opening match.

##
Production[[edit](/w/index.php?title=WWE_Greatest_Royal_Rumble&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Production")]

###
Background[[edit](/w/index.php?title=WWE_Greatest_Royal_Rumble&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Background")]

Since 1988, the Royal Rumble has been an annual event held by WWE and is
typically shown on [pay-per-view](/wiki/Pay-per-view "Pay-per-view").[10] The
event is highlighted by the Royal Rumble match, a [battle
royal](/wiki/Battle_royal_\(professional_wrestling\) "Battle royal
\(professional wrestling\)") whose participants enter at timed intervals.[11]
The Greatest Royal Rumble included the largest version of the match to date,
having a total of 50 participants.

On March 5, 2018, WWE and the [Saudi General Sports
Authority](/wiki/General_Sports_Authority "General Sports Authority")
advertised the Greatest Royal Rumble, a live event to be held on April 27,
2018, at King Abdullah International Stadium, part of the King Abdullah Sports
City, in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia.[12][13] The event is a part of a 10-year
strategic multi-platform partnership between WWE and the Saudi General Sports
Authority in support of [Saudi Vision 2030](/wiki/Saudi_Vision_2030 "Saudi
Vision 2030"), Saudi Arabia's social and economic reform program.[3][14]

On March 19, 2018, WWE scheduled seven championship matches for the event: the
[WWE Championship](/wiki/WWE_Championship "WWE Championship"), [Universal
Championship](/wiki/WWE_Universal_Championship "WWE Universal Championship"),
[United States Championship](/wiki/WWE_United_States_Championship "WWE United
States Championship"), [Intercontinental
Championship](/wiki/WWE_Intercontinental_Championship "WWE Intercontinental
Championship"), [SmackDown Tag Team
Championship](/wiki/WWE_SmackDown_Tag_Team_Championship "WWE SmackDown Tag
Team Championship"), [Raw Tag Team
Championship](/wiki/WWE_Raw_Tag_Team_Championship "WWE Raw Tag Team
Championship") and [Cruiserweight
Championship](/wiki/WWE_Cruiserweight_Championship "WWE Cruiserweight
Championship") were to be defended at the event.

As revealed on March 22, 2018, the event was streamed live on the WWE
Network.[6] It also aired on traditional pay-per-view in the United States[15]
and internationally.[4] The event was also the first WWE pay-per-view to
feature [Arabic](/wiki/Modern_Standard_Arabic "Modern Standard Arabic")
commentary.[16]

In the weeks leading up to the event, the WWE held tryouts in Saudi Arabia.
From these tryouts, eight were selected to receive training by WWE, which
would include an opportunity to earn a spot at the Greatest Royal Rumble event
itself.[17]

###
Storylines[[edit](/w/index.php?title=WWE_Greatest_Royal_Rumble&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Storylines")]

The card comprised ten matches that resulted from scripted storylines and had
results predetermined by [WWE](/wiki/WWE "WWE") on the
[Raw](/wiki/Raw_\(WWE_brand\) "Raw \(WWE brand\)") and
[SmackDown](/wiki/SmackDown_\(WWE_brand\) "SmackDown \(WWE brand\)")
[brands](/wiki/WWE_brand_extension "WWE brand extension").[18][19] Storylines
were produced on WWE's weekly television shows, _[Monday Night
Raw](/wiki/WWE_Raw "WWE Raw")_ , _[SmackDown Live](/wiki/WWE_SmackDown "WWE
SmackDown")_ ,[20] and the
[cruiserweight](/wiki/Cruiserweight_\(professional_wrestling\) "Cruiserweight
\(professional wrestling\)")-exclusive _[205 Live](/wiki/WWE_205_Live "WWE 205
Live")_.[21]

On April 9, [Brock Lesnar](/wiki/Brock_Lesnar "Brock Lesnar"), who had renewed
his WWE contract, was scheduled to defend the Universal Championship against
[Roman Reigns](/wiki/Roman_Reigns "Roman Reigns") in a [steel cage
match](/wiki/Professional_wrestling_match_types#Steel_cage_match "Professional
wrestling match types") as a rematch from [WrestleMania
34](/wiki/WrestleMania_34 "WrestleMania 34").[22][23] On _Raw_ following
WrestleMania, Reigns expressed frustration about not being told about his
future matches and opponents, singling out the steel cage match with Lesnar.
Reigns alleged that there was a conspiracy against him. [Samoa
Joe](/wiki/Samoa_Joe "Samoa Joe"), who had been out with an injury since
January, came out and warned Reigns that Lesnar would beat him again.[24]

On March 26, WWE scheduled a [ladder match](/wiki/Ladder_match "Ladder match")
between then-champion [The Miz](/wiki/The_Miz "The Miz"), [Seth
Rollins](/wiki/Seth_Rollins "Seth Rollins"), [Finn
Bálor](/wiki/Finn_B%C3%A1lor "Finn Bálor"), and Samoa Joe for the
Intercontinental Championship.[25] At WrestleMania 34, The Miz lost the
Intercontinental Championship to Rollins, thus making Rollins the defending
champion.[26] Both Miz and Joe were [traded
to](/wiki/2018_WWE_Superstar_Shake-up "2018 WWE Superstar Shake-up") SmackDown
while Rollins and Bálor remained on Raw.[27][28]

On March 26, [Cesaro and Sheamus](/wiki/Cesaro_and_Sheamus "Cesaro and
Sheamus") were scheduled to defend the Raw Tag Team Championship against [The
Hardy Boyz](/wiki/The_Hardy_Boyz "The Hardy Boyz") ([Jeff](/wiki/Jeff_Hardy
"Jeff Hardy") and [Matt Hardy](/wiki/Matt_Hardy "Matt Hardy")).[25] At
WrestleMania 34, however, Cesaro and Sheamus lost the titles to [Braun
Strowman](/wiki/Braun_Strowman "Braun Strowman") and 10-year-old Nicholas.[26]
The following night on _Raw_ , Strowman and Nicholas relinquished the titles
due to Nicholas being a fourth grader. Cesaro and Sheamus demanded their
titles back, but Raw General Manager [Kurt Angle](/wiki/Kurt_Angle "Kurt
Angle") instead scheduled them to face the winner of the four-team Tag Team
Eliminator tournament for the vacant titles at the Greatest Royal Rumble.[24]
["Woken" Matt Hardy](/wiki/Matt_Hardy "Matt Hardy") and [Bray
Wyatt](/wiki/Bray_Wyatt "Bray Wyatt") won the tournament by defeating Titus
Worldwide ([Apollo Crews](/wiki/Apollo_Crews "Apollo Crews") and [Titus
O'Neil](/wiki/Titus_O%27Neil "Titus O'Neil")) and [The
Revival](/wiki/The_Revival_\(professional_wrestling\) "The Revival
\(professional wrestling\)") ([Dash Wilder](/wiki/Dash_Wilder "Dash Wilder")
and [Scott Dawson](/wiki/Scott_Dawson_\(wrestler\) "Scott Dawson
\(wrestler\)")).[27] Cesaro and Sheamus were then traded to SmackDown during
the Superstar Shake-up.[28]

At WrestleMania 34, [The Bludgeon Brothers](/wiki/The_Bludgeon_Brothers "The
Bludgeon Brothers") ([Harper](/wiki/Luke_Harper "Luke Harper") and
[Rowan](/wiki/Erick_Rowan "Erick Rowan")) defeated [The Usos](/wiki/The_Usos
"The Usos") (Jey and Jimmy Uso) and [The New
Day's](/wiki/The_New_Day_\(professional_wrestling\) "The New Day
\(professional wrestling\)") [Big E](/wiki/Big_E_\(wrestler\) "Big E
\(wrestler\)") and [Kofi Kingston](/wiki/Kofi_Kingston "Kofi Kingston") in a
triple threat tag team match to win the SmackDown Tag Team Championship.[26]
On the following _SmackDown_ , The Usos defeated The New Day to earn a title
match at Greatest Royal Rumble.[29]

A match between [John Cena](/wiki/John_Cena "John Cena") and [Triple
H](/wiki/Triple_H "Triple H") was scheduled on March 26.[25]

[The Undertaker](/wiki/The_Undertaker "The Undertaker"), was originally
scheduled to face [Rusev](/wiki/Rusev_\(wrestler\) "Rusev \(wrestler\)") in a
[casket match](/wiki/Professional_wrestling_match_types#Casket_match
"Professional wrestling match types"), the first match of its kind in three
years.[30] Due to reasons not entirely clear, Rusev was temporarily replaced
by [Chris Jericho](/wiki/Chris_Jericho "Chris Jericho")[31] — this was
explained with Rusev's wife [Lana](/wiki/Lana_\(wrestling\) "Lana
\(wrestling\)") complaining about her husband competing in a casket match[32]
— but eventually reinserted back into the match. Jericho was restored to his
original participation in the Greatest Royal Rumble match.[33]

At WrestleMania 34, [Jinder Mahal](/wiki/Jinder_Mahal "Jinder Mahal") defeated
[Randy Orton](/wiki/Randy_Orton "Randy Orton"), [Bobby
Roode](/wiki/Bobby_Roode "Bobby Roode"), and Rusev in a fatal-four way match
to win the United States Championship.[26] Mahal was then traded to Raw and
lost the championship to [Jeff Hardy](/wiki/Jeff_Hardy "Jeff Hardy") and Mahal
invoked his rematch clause for the Greatest Royal Rumble.[27] Hardy was then
traded to SmackDown the following night.[28]

At WrestleMania 34, [AJ Styles](/wiki/A.J._Styles "A.J. Styles") successfully
defended the WWE Championship against [Shinsuke
Nakamura](/wiki/Shinsuke_Nakamura "Shinsuke Nakamura"). After the match,
showed his respect to Styles but then attacked him with a low blow and a
_Kinshasa_ , turning [heel](/wiki/Heel_\(professional_wrestling\) "Heel
\(professional wrestling\)").[26] On April 17, after repeated attacks on
Styles by Nakamura, a rematch between the two was scheduled for the Greatest
Royal Rumble.[28]

On the WrestleMania 34 pre-show, [Cedric Alexander](/wiki/Cedric_Alexander
"Cedric Alexander") defeated [Mustafa Ali](/wiki/Mustafa_Ali_\(wrestler\)
"Mustafa Ali \(wrestler\)") in the [WWE Cruiserweight Championship tournament
final](/wiki/WWE_tournaments#WWE_Cruiserweight_Championship_Tournament_\(2018\)
"WWE tournaments") to win the vacant title.[34] Two nights later on _205 Live_
, [Buddy Murphy](/wiki/Buddy_Murphy "Buddy Murphy") attacked the new champion
during his celebration.[35] Murphy was then scheduled to face Alexander for
the title at the Greatest Royal Rumble, but he failed his mandatory weigh-in
when he weighed 207 pounds, 2 pounds over the 205 pound weight limit. He was
then removed from the match and banned from competing on _205 Live_ until he
met the weight requirement.[36] The following week,
[Kalisto](/wiki/Kalisto_\(wrestler\) "Kalisto \(wrestler\)") earned a
Cruiserweight Championship match at the Greatest Royal Rumble by winning a
gauntlet match.[37]

The actual pay-per-view opened with John Cena facing Triple H. During the
match, after trading finishers, and reversing each other's finishers, Cena
performed an _Attitude Adjustment_ on Triple H, a springboard into the corner
turnbuckle, followed and another _Attitude Adjustment_ to pick up the victory.
Following the match Cena thanked the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia for their
hospitality, and expressed excitement over the event.[38]

In the following match, Cedric Alexander defended the Cruiserweight
Championship against Kalisto. The match ended when Alexander countered a
_Salida Del Sol_ attempt into a _Lumbar Check_ to retain the title.[38]

Next, the vacant Raw Tag Team Championship was contested between the team of
Bray Wyatt and Matt Hardy and the former champions, Cesaro and Sheamus. In the
end, Hardy distracted Sheamus, allowing Wyatt to perform a _Sister Abigail_ on
him. Hardy and Wyatt then performed a _wheelbarrow Twist of Fate_ on Sheamus
to win the title.[38]

Jeff Hardy then defended the United States Championship against Jinder Mahal.
In the end, Hardy performed a _Swanton Bomb_ on Mahal to retain the title.[38]

After that, The Bludgeons Brothers defended the SmackDown Tag Team
Championship against The Usos. Harper and Rowan retained their titles after
performing a _Double Crucifix Powerbomb_ on Jimmy Uso.[38]

Next, Seth Rollins defended the Intercontinental Championship against Finn
Balor, Samoa Joe and The Miz in a Ladder match. Near the end of the match,
Finn Balor climbed the ladder to unhook the championship, only for Rollins to
leap from the top rope onto the ladder and managed to retrieve the title belt
before Balor, thus retaining his championship.[38]

Later, AJ Styles defended the WWE Championship against Shinsuke Nakamura.
During the match, Nakamura resorted to various illegal tactics, such as a _Low
Blow_ , increasingly frustrating Styles. In the end, both Nakamura and Styles
brawled outside of the ring only for the match to end in a double countout.
Post-match Styles performed a _Phenomenal Forearm_ over the top rope on
Nakamura.[38]

After that, The Undertaker fought Rusev (who was accompanied by Aiden English)
in a Casket match. At the end of the match, Undertaker performed a Chokeslam
on Rusev and rolled him into the casket. Before he could close the lid,
English attacked the Undertaker, who retailiated with another Chokeslam and a
Tombstone Piledriver before putting English into the casket alongside Rusev
and closing it for the victory.[38]

In the penultimate match, Brock Lesnar (accompanied by Paul Heyman) defended
the Universal Championship against Roman Reigns in a steel cage match. Lesnar
delivered multiple _German Suplexes_ during the match, and both men kicked out
of each other's finishing moves. At one point in the match, Reigns tried to
escape the cage through the door only for Heyman to slam the door on Reigns.
The match ended after Reigns put Lesnar through the cage wall with a _Spear_ ,
sending it onto the floor. Despite Reigns touching the floor with both feet
first, the referee awarded the win to Lesnar, thereby retaining the Universal
Championship.[38]

### Main
event[[edit](/w/index.php?title=WWE_Greatest_Royal_Rumble&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Main event")]

[Daniel Bryan](/wiki/Daniel_Bryan "Daniel Bryan") and [Dolph
Ziggler](/wiki/Dolph_Ziggler "Dolph Ziggler") began the 50-man Royal Rumble
match as the first two entrants. Bryan survived until the final 3, beating out
[Rey Mysterio](/wiki/Rey_Mysterio "Rey Mysterio") for the longest time spent
in a single Royal Rumble match of all time at an hour and sixteen minutes. At
the end of the match, [Big Cass](/wiki/Big_Cass "Big Cass") eliminated Bryan
only for Cass to then attempt a _Big Boot_ on [Braun
Strowman](/wiki/Braun_Strowman "Braun Strowman"), who ducked and knocked Cass
over the top rope to win the match. Strowman also achieved the most
eliminations of a single Royal Rumble match at 13, beating out a record
previously held by Roman Reigns with 12.[39] Post-match, Strowman received a
trophy and the Greatest Royal Rumble Championship.[38]

##
Controversy[[edit](/w/index.php?title=WWE_Greatest_Royal_Rumble&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: Controversy")]

See also: [Women in WWE](/wiki/Women_in_WWE "Women in WWE")

WWE had been criticized for holding the event without female wrestlers, who
were unable to perform at the event due to the [limited rights women have in
Saudi Arabia](/wiki/Women%27s_rights_in_Saudi_Arabia "Women's rights in Saudi
Arabia").[40][41] [Triple H](/wiki/Triple_H "Triple H"), WWE's Executive Vice
President of Talent, Live Events and Creative, responded to the criticism: "I
understand that people are questioning it, but you have to understand that
every culture is different and just because you don’t agree with a certain
aspect of it, it doesn’t mean it’s not a relevant culture...You can’t dictate
to a country or a religion about how they handle things but, having said that,
WWE is at the forefront of a women’s evolution in the world and what you can’t
do is effect change anywhere by staying away from it....While women are not
competing in the event, we have had discussions about that and hope that, in
the next few years they will be".[40] Women were in attendance for the event,
though only if [accompanied by a male
guardian](/wiki/Women%27s_rights_in_Saudi_Arabia#Male_guardians "Women's
rights in Saudi Arabia").[40] This was a major change from previous events,
which were only open to men. [Associated Press](/wiki/Associated_Press
"Associated Press") noted that this is due to "a series of social changes" by
the Crown Prince [Mohammad bin Salman](/wiki/Mohammad_bin_Salman "Mohammad bin
Salman").[42] During the event, WWE aired a promotional video, which included
WWE female wrestlers. The Saudi General Sports Authority issued an apology for
"indecent material" that aired at the event.[43]

In addition to the women, wrestler [Sami Zayn](/wiki/Sami_Zayn "Sami Zayn")
did not participate in the event as Zayn is of [Syrian](/wiki/Syrian_people
"Syrian people") descent, and Saudi Arabia has strained relations with
Syria.[44]

Another subject of criticism was the situation of [LGBT rights in Saudi
Arabia](/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Saudi_Arabia "LGBT rights in Saudi Arabia"), as
in Saudi Arabia homosexual intercourse is illegal and can be punished by
death.[45]

The **WWE Greatest Royal Rumble Championship** , also known as the **Belt
Kingdom Championship** ([Arabic](/wiki/Arabic "Arabic"): **حزام بطولة
المملكة**), is a [professional wrestling
championship](/wiki/Professional_wrestling_championship "Professional
wrestling championship") created and promoted by American [professional
wrestling promotion](/wiki/Professional_wrestling_promotion "Professional
wrestling promotion") [WWE](/wiki/WWE "WWE") and sanctioned by the [Saudi
General Sports Authority](/wiki/General_Sports_Authority "General Sports
Authority").[58] The current and inaugural champion is [Braun
Strowman](/wiki/Braun_Strowman "Braun Strowman"), who was awarded the
championship for winning the 50-man Greatest Royal Rumble match at the
namesake event.

###
History[[edit](/w/index.php?title=WWE_Greatest_Royal_Rumble&action=edit&section=12
"Edit section: History")]

On March 5, 2018, WWE and the [Saudi General Sports
Authority](/wiki/General_Sports_Authority "General Sports Authority")
advertised the Greatest Royal Rumble, a live event to be held on April 27,
2018, at King Abdullah International Stadium, part of the King Abdullah Sports
City, in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia.[12][13] The event was part of a 10-year
strategic multi-platform partnership between WWE and the Saudi General Sports
Authority in support of [Saudi Vision 2030](/wiki/Saudi_Vision_2030 "Saudi
Vision 2030"), Saudi Arabia's social and economic reform program.[3][14] The
Greatest Royal Rumble Championship was unveiled by WWE on April 27, 2018
during the Greatest Royal Rumble event.[59] The championship was announced on
the official website of the [Saudi General Sports
Authority](/wiki/General_Sports_Authority "General Sports Authority") as the
Belt Kingdom Championship.[60] [Braun Strowman](/wiki/Braun_Strowman "Braun
Strowman"), the 41st entrant of the 50-man [Greatest Royal Rumble
match](/wiki/Royal_Rumble_match "Royal Rumble match"), became the inaugural
Greatest Royal Rumble Champion by lastly eliminating [Big Cass](/wiki/Big_Cass
"Big Cass").[61][62][63]

### Championship belt
design[[edit](/w/index.php?title=WWE_Greatest_Royal_Rumble&action=edit&section=13
"Edit section: Championship belt design")]

As with some other championship belts unveiled in 2016, the base design is
[similar](/wiki/WWE_Championship#Current_design "WWE Championship") to the
[WWE Championship](/wiki/WWE_Championship "WWE Championship"), with notable
differences.[64] Instead of a large cut out of the WWE logo, the center plate
is modeled with Arabic pattern with the WWE logo in the center. Like the WWE
Championship belt and other belts introduced in 2016 and 2017, the Greatest
Royal Rumble Championship belt features two side plates, both separated by
gold divider bars, with removable round sections that can be replaced with the
current champion's logo; the default plates feature the official logo of
[Saudi General Sports Authority](/wiki/General_Sports_Authority "General
Sports Authority") which is identical to the [national emblem of Saudi
Arabia](/wiki/Emblem_of_Saudi_Arabia "Emblem of Saudi Arabia"). The plates are
on a green leather strap resembling the color of the [national flag of Saudi
Arabia](/wiki/Flag_of_Saudi_Arabia "Flag of Saudi Arabia").

current champion, [Braun Strowman](/wiki/Braun_Strowman "Braun Strowman").
